t: To the chief Musician upon Gittith, A Psalm of Asaph.
Sing*p aloud unto God our strength: make a joyful noise unto the God of Jacob.
Take*p a psalm, and bring hither the timbrel, the pleasant harp with the psaltery.
Blow*p up the trumpet in the new moon, in the time appointed, on our solemn feast day.
For*p this was a statute for Israel, and a law of the God of Jacob.
This*p he ordained in Joseph for a testimony, when he went out through the land of Egypt: where I heard a language that I understood not.
I*p removed his shoulder from the burden: his hands were delivered from the pots.
Thou*p calledst in trouble, and I delivered thee; I answered thee in the secret place of thunder: I proved thee at the waters of Meribah. Selah.
Hear,*p O my people, and I will testify unto thee: O Israel, if thou wilt hearken unto me;
There*p shall no strange god be in thee; neither shalt thou worship any strange god.
I*p am the Lord*s thy God, which brought thee out of the land of Egypt: open thy mouth wide, and I will fill it.
But*p my people would not hearken to my voice; and Israel would none of me.
So*p I gave them up unto their own hearts' lust: and they walked in their own counsels.
Oh*p that my people had hearkened unto me, and Israel had walked in my ways!
I*p should soon have subdued their enemies, and turned my hand against their adversaries.
The*p haters of the Lord*s should have submitted themselves unto him: but their time should have endured for ever.
He*p should have fed them also with the finest of the wheat: and with honey out of the rock should I have satisfied thee.
